Description: Marl pottery jar of squat globular shape with rounded base and everted ledge rim, two pierced cylindrical handles on the shoulder. Exterior is decorated in red paint with two sets of staggered line motifs on opposing sides of the body; three vertical lines run from rim to base over the handles.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D15 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery The staggered line motif has been identified as representing architecture, probably a fence as discussed in: Graff, G., Eyckerman, M.,& Hendrickx, S., 2011. Architectural elements on Decorated pottery and the ritual presentation of desert animals, in:R. Friedman & P.N. Fiske (eds), Egypt At its origins3. Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta 205,Leuven: 448–451.
